item.title: Ticket #262 (Comment moderation always matches with spam word trailing newline) updated
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description: Just spotted this has been resolved by Dougal in cvs. Sorry for the noise. Can be resolved

item.title: Ticket #262 (Comment moderation always matches with spam word trailing newline) created
item.dc:creator: mikelittle
item.description: If your list of spam words (in options -> discussion -> comment moderation -> spam words) has newline after the last word, the method check_comment() always matches. That is it thinks every comment contains a spam word.

item.title: Ticket #261 (Re-selecting default ping and comment status) created
item.dc:creator: Beel
item.description:
Once deselected, there is no ability to turn them back on. I added this to options.php: if( in_array($option->option_name, $nonbools) && $new_val == 1 ) $new_val = 'open';

if ($new_val !== $old_val)

$result = $wpdb->query("UPDATE $wpdb->options SET option_value = '$new_val' WHERE option_name = '$option->option_name'");

item.title: Ticket #260 (Can NOT update user profile.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
can not update user profile, cuz missing of *user_description* column you can see following when update user profile. -- cut here -- Database error: [Unknown column 'user_description' in 'field list'] UPDATE wp_users SET user_firstname=, user_pass=MD5('test'), user_lastname=, user_nickname='test', user_icq=, user_email='test@…', user_url='​http://', user_aim=, user_msn=, user_yim=, user_idmode='nickname', user_description = , user_nicename = 'test' WHERE ID = 1

ERROR: couldn't update your profile... -- cut here --

item.title: Ticket #212 (Permalink Options: Instructions to 'select all' is Windows-specific) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: rboren is techincally correct, but for firefox users on any platform (if I am correct) ctrl+a does not select all. Not the greatest thing to have when there's a GET FIREFOX button at the bottom of the admin panel

item.title: Ticket #258 (trackback uri broken again in 1.3) created
item.dc:creator: Ihad
item.description:
the trackback uris generated by WP 1.3 alpha3 are e.g.:

​http://www.ihad.de/wordpress/wp-trackback.php/19

which only results in a 404

i tried the various suggested fixes (post.php / functions.php) on the forums to no avail. my permalink structure is not set to anything (i.e. all default wp install, no plugins active, just a clean install, drop and go).
